summary: chipotle has decided to tap into the $ 70 billion food delivery market by teaming up with an app to bring burritos straight to customers ' doors . the fast-casual chain will work with the postmates app to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities . the restaurant plans to add a nine per cent service charge - with the delivery fees for postmates beginning at $ 5 and up depending on distance and demand .

aspect: 1. Mexican restaurant Chipotle partners with Postmates to offer delivery in 67 cities, adding a 9% service charge.
2. Chipotle rejects previous offers for delivery, but accepts Postmates collaboration, following success and presidential candidate visits.
3. Chipotle joins other franchises in the delivery market, with competition from McDonald's, Starbucks, Taco Bell, and Burger King.
explain: Chipotle, a Mexican restaurant, has partnered with Postmates to provide delivery services in 67 cities with an additional 9% service charge. The delivery fees will vary depending on the demand and distance.

In recent years, Chipotle has rejected prior delivery service offers. However, with the success of their own online ordering and the visits of presidential candidates, the company has now decided to collaborate with Postmates to start offering delivery in 67 cities. This decision is seen as an attempt to tap into the $70 billion food delivery market and enhance customer access to their popular burritos. By adding a nine percent service charge for delivery with varying fees depending on distance and demand, the company also aims to maintain control of its operations during this pivotal moment in their evolution.

Chipotle is expanding its services by partnering with Postmates app to deliver burritos in 67 cities, joining competitors like McDonald's, Starbucks, Taco Bell, and Burger King already offering delivery services.
